news.title: The individuals scheduled to perform at events for Trump‚Äôs inauguration
news.text:
WASHINGTON ‚Äî Country singer Carrie Underwood will perform ‚ÄúAmerica the Beautiful‚Äù at the inauguration of Donald Trump Monday, signaling a thawing relationship between Trump and some of the A-list of Hollywood. 

Several other well-known artists are performing at one of the inaugural balls including Rascal Flatts, Gavin DeGraw, Jason Aldean, The Village People and Nelly. Rapper Snoop Dogg performed at a pre-inaugural ‚ÄúCrypto Ball‚Äù on Friday night. 

Underwood is set to perform Monday shortly before Trump takes the oath of office in the U.S. Capitol Rotunda on Jan. 20. 

‚ÄúI love our country and am honored to have been asked to sing at the Inauguration and to be a small part of this historic event,‚Äù Underwood said in a statement about her role in the event. ‚ÄúI am humbled to answer the call at a time when we must all come together in the spirit of unity and looking to the future.‚Äù

The Grammy-winning artist is notably a higher-tier celebrity than Trump traditionally attracts at his events. Many leading music and film celebrities were prominent anti-Trump voices during the past three elections. 

Other inauguration ceremony performers will include two of the president-elect‚Äôs musical favorites, country singer Lee Greenwood and opera singer Christopher Macchio.

Greenwood will perform as Trump walks out to take the oath, according to Trump‚Äôs inaugural committee. Macchio is Trump‚Äôs choice to perform the National Anthem at the end of the program.

The Village People aren‚Äôt performing at the inauguration ceremony, but the American disco group is set to perform at one of Trump‚Äôs inaugural balls over the weekend and a rally he‚Äôs holding in Washington the day before he‚Äôs sworn in.

‚ÄúWe know this won‚Äôt make some of you happy to hear however we believe that music is to be performed without regard to politics,‚Äù the band said in a post on its Facebook page Monday. ‚ÄúOur song Y.M.C.A. is a global anthem that hopefully helps bring the country together after a tumultuous and divided campaign where our preferred candidate lost. Therefore, we believe it‚Äôs now time to bring the country together with music which is why VILLAGE PEOPLE will be performing at various events as part of the 2025 Inauguration of Donald J. Trump.‚Äù

The band is best known for their hit song, ‚ÄúY.M.C.A.,‚Äù which is widely considered a gay anthem ‚Äî and became a staple of Trump‚Äôs rallies in the last election, along with ‚ÄúMacho Man.‚Äù

Kid Rock, a longtime Trump supporter, and Billy Ray Cyrus will join Lee Greenwood and The Village People at the ‚ÄúMake America Great Again Rally‚Äù at Capital One Arena in downtown D.C. on Sunday, along with a choir from Liberty University.

Jason Aldean, a five-time Grammy nominee behind the controversial song ‚ÄúTry That in a Small Town,‚Äù is set to perform at The Liberty Ball on Monday night, alongside The Village People and rapper Nelly. 

Country group Rascal Flatts will be at the Commander-in-Chief Ball, focused on military service members, with Texas-based singer-songwriter Parker McCollum.

The Starlight Ball, focused on high-dollar donors, will feature a performance from Gavin DeGraw, a singer-songwriter best known for the song ‚ÄúI Don‚Äôt Want to Be,‚Äù which was used as the theme song for the CW show ‚ÄúOne Tree Hill.‚Äù

Trump‚Äôs first inauguration in 2017 featured performances from the Rockettes, the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and 16-year-old ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs Got Talent‚Äù singer Jackie Evancho.

Biden‚Äôs inauguration, after beating Trump in the 2020 election, featured several celebrities of the caliber that traditionally shunned Trump and other Republicans. Lady Gaga, J. Lo and Garth Brooks all took to the stage to celebrate the inauguration. 

The Associated Press contributed to this report.
news.summary:
Internewscast Journal

Internewscast


Several well-known artists are performing at the inaugural balls including rapper Nelly.…

news.title: Pacers Reminded Of What They Were Missing With Aaron Nesmith Returning
news.text:
Share to Facebook

Share to Twitter

Share to Linkedin

Detroit Pistons forward Tobias Harris (12) is guarded by Indiana Pacers forward Aaron Nesmith (23) ... [+] during the first half of an NBA basketball game Thursday, Jan. 16, 2025, in Detroit. (AP Photo/Duane Burleson)
Copyright 2025 The Associated Press. All rights reserved.

DETROIT ‚Äî Entering Thursday, 76 days had passed since Aaron Nesmith last played for the Indiana Pacers. On November 1 of last year, the fifth-year forward rolled his ankle on the foot of New Orleans Pelicans head coach Willie Green, and he suffered a unique ankle injury that kept him out for 35 games. The Pacers were missing a starter from last year‚Äôs group that reached the Eastern Conference Finals.

The team found a way to get by ‚Äî Bennedict Mathurin has filled in well as Indiana‚Äôs fifth starter, and that opening five has been pummeling opponents. But as Nesmith returned to the hardwood on Thursday night in Detroit, the Pacers were reminded what they were missing without the 25-year old.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a strong, athletic wing that shoots the ball and moves and runs and can defend. He rebounds pretty well at his position. It‚Äôll be great to have him back out there. I know he‚Äôs excited,‚Äù Pacers head coach Rick Carlisle said of Nesmith‚Äôs return before the game. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs worked extremely hard. His build up to this moment, behind the scenes, has been very gradual, very arduous. It had to be taken in very small steps. So it‚Äôs great news that he‚Äôs out there tonight and I know he‚Äôs looking forward to it.‚Äù

Nesmith couldn‚Äôt wait to play. He never anticipated he‚Äôd be out for this long with his injury but had to trust the Pacers medical staff. It was the longest time he‚Äôd missed in the NBA due to injury, which made Nesmith appreciate playing even more.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a journey. Longer than I think anybody would have wanted,‚Äù Nesmith said of the rehab process. He made sure to listen to Indiana‚Äôs training staff every step of the way. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a long time. I‚Äôm excited to finally play in an NBA game again.‚Äù

MORE FOR YOU

TikTok Ban: Trump Suggests He‚Äôll Delay Ban‚ÄîHere‚Äôs Everything We Know

What Time Will The TikTok Ban Start In The U.S.? Here‚Äôs What Could Happen

Donald Trump Launches $TRUMP Meme Coin‚ÄîToken Nears $6 Billion Market Cap

Such a lengthy absence meant that Nesmith was going to be limited in terms of the number of minutes he could play against the Pistons. With Mathurin out due to a suspension, though, the Pacers opted to start the Vanderbilt product. Their opening five from much of last season was reunited, but what exactly Nesmith was going to provide after missing nearly half of a season was unclear.

What did Aaron Nesmith‚Äôs return for the Pacers look like?

He was the last starter announced for the blue and gold in Little Caesars Arena. Indiana needed the former lottery pick to be impactful ‚Äî their game against the Pistons was important. The two teams are close in the standings and are still working to determine their head-to-head tiebreaker for the season.

Plus, going against a team that starts games with Ausar Thompson, Cade Cunningham, and Tobias Harris on the court meant Nesmith was going to be covering a top-three option on Detroit‚Äôs roster. There was no time for the three-and-D wing to ease into things.

Fortunately for the Pacers, he didn‚Äôt. Nemsith grabbed a rebound 54 seconds into the game, then took his first shot about two minutes into the action. He was starting plays in the corner but found ways to get involved. That‚Äôs what Nesmith has always done in a potent Pacers offense.

With 8:15 on the clock in the first quarter, Nesmith took his second shot attempt ‚Äî a 27-foot three-point jumper. He drilled it, his first points this season since the second quarter of that fateful game in New Orleans. 1:08 later, the wing drove around a screen from Pascal Siakam and hit a tough layup. Nesmith was back and doing his job.

‚ÄúIt was good to get a couple shots to fall in early and get my rhythm back quickly,‚Äù Nesmith said after the game.

His first stint lasted for about six minutes and ended with the Pacers up by one. It was a dreamy start for the ascending wing, who already had five points and had held his matchup, Tobias Harris, scoreless.

Nesmith re-entered early in the second quarter, this time with a bench-filled lineup. His only box score contribution during this stint was a free throw generated by a technical foul, but the Pacers lead was six when Nesmith left the floor. One again, he made the blue and gold better.

Detroit Pistons forward Simone Fontecchio, center, tries to drive the lane against Indiana Pacers ... [+] guard T.J. McConnell (9) and center Thomas Bryant (3) during the first half of an NBA basketball game Thursday, Jan. 16, 2025, in Detroit. (AP Photo/Duane Burleson)
Copyright 2025 The Associated Press. All rights reserved.

That was it for Nesmith. He played 9:18 in total, and the Pacers won those minutes by four points. From the start of the second quarter onward, Indiana never trailed as they rolled to an 11-point win.

Nesmith‚Äôs final stat line showed nine points and one rebound. The Pacers won his minutes by four, and the NBA‚Äôs matchup data says that Pistons players being defended by Nesmith shot 2/5 from the field. The South Carolina native did everything that he‚Äôs shown for the Pacers the last few years without missing a beat.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs Aaron Nesmith. He‚Äôs going to defend at a high level, make open shots, play the right way,‚Äù Pacers star guard Tyrese Haliburton said postgame. ‚ÄúJust glad to get him back... he can fit anywhere.‚Äù

Indiana knows Nesmith can defend and hit outside shots. He‚Äôs done that ever since the team acquired him via trade in 2022. He played well enough for the blue and gold to receive a contract extension last summer, and he has since become a reliable starter ‚Äî and a reliable three-and-D wing in the Circle City.

Thursday served as a reminder of those facts. A 35-game absence forced the Pacers to change their play style slightly, both because they didn‚Äôt have Nesmith‚Äôs abilities and because his replacement in the starting five, Mathurin, has different skills. Determining which of those two players should start going forward will be a major question for the Pacers, but with Nesmith back and available, the Pacers will be more malleable. There‚Äôs more lineups Carlisle can put on the floor that will make sense.

That was already clear in Detroit. Nesmith was a part of three different five-man combinations, and all three outscored the Pistons. His skills fit with anyone and make units complete.

‚ÄúI felt good out there,‚Äù Nesmith said. I didn‚Äôt feel like I was a step behind, I felt like I was able to find my rhythm pretty easily.‚Äù

The Pacers will have some lineup questions to figure out in the immediate future. Finding answers to those questions will be easier with Nesmith back in the fold, and the young wing reminded everyone of that on Thursday night.

Follow me on Twitter. Check out my website.

Forbes Accolades
news.summary: Indiana Pacers wing Aaron Nesmith returned to the hardwood on Thursday, and he quickly reminded the Pacers and the rest of the NBA what he can do.
news.author: Contributor,Tony East

news.title: TikTok Ban‚ÄîWill Your iPhone And Android Apps Be Deleted Tomorrow?
news.text:
Share to Facebook

Share to Twitter

Share to Linkedin

Tick-tock for TikTok
Anadolu via Getty Images

So here we are‚Äîthe long-running TikTok ban saga finally enters what could be its end-zone just hours from now. All 170 million U.S. users will be questioning what happens next, and what they can expect when they wake up Sunday morning.

While we originally expected the app to continue working for existing users post a ban coming into effect, that now seems not to be the case. TikTok has essentially warned that it will ‚Äúgo dark‚Äù in the U.S., given that service providers underpinning the platform won‚Äôt be able to continue doing so lawfully.

ForbesNew Hacking Disaster Warning For Gmail, Outlook, Apple Mail UsersBy Zak Doffman

The inside track from TikTok appears to be that you will be directed to a website with a message and explanation from the platform, and perhaps an option to download your data. Although for all 100-million-plus users to do that all at once might stretch the ecosystem, so be ready for some chaos and delays. There‚Äôs no confirmation on timing. It could be midnight or some time shortly afterwards. There‚Äôs still a chance a last minute deal will let it run until the change of administration next week.

Many users have asked whether a VPN will resolve the issue ‚Äî as has been the case with state-wide porn shut-outs across the U.S., where users turn to VPNs to pretend they‚Äôre somewhere else. That seems unlikely to work here, given the platform itself is going dark as opposed to being blocked. But we‚Äôll know more on Sunday.

MORE FOR YOU

TikTok Ban: Trump Suggests He‚Äôll Delay Ban‚ÄîHere‚Äôs Everything We Know

What Time Will The TikTok Ban Start In The U.S.? Here‚Äôs What Could Happen

Donald Trump Launches $TRUMP Meme Coin‚ÄîToken Nears $6 Billion Market Cap

It‚Äôs critical that you do two things before the ban comes into effect. First make sure your account has been secured, which will help you restore it if and when it comes back. You can find details on doing that here. And second, don‚Äôt fall for any lures coming at you by email or message or social media post, promising to restore yoiur account or provide a workaround. They will be dangerous scams.

ForbesMicrosoft‚Äôs Forced Upgrade‚ÄîNew Warning For 450 Million Windows PC OwnersBy Zak Doffman

Most expect some form of fudge if not tomorrow then early next week, with the new Trump administration giving TikTok a pass for 60-90 days, time for the situation to resolve. That could still mean 24-72 hours of darkness though, so just make sure you‚Äôre prepared. With unfortunate timing, TikTok is now under fire in Europe, with a new privacy lawsuit claiming it unlawfully sends data to China. TikTok tells me it strongly denies the claim and I don‚Äôt expect it to make any difference in the U.S.

Your app won‚Äôt disappear from your phone tomorrow and you don‚Äôt need to delete it. But it won‚Äôt work if the platform goes dark until it is restored and it won‚Äôt be available in any of the app stores. The risk of an app with no access to security updates running on 170 million phones does seem to have passed with the latest turn of events, which is good, but for millions of users this new ‚Äúdark‚Äù reality could be worse.

Above all, don‚Äôt do anything rash. And keep your fingers crossed.

Follow me on Twitter or LinkedIn. 

Zak Doffman

Editorial Standards

Forbes Accolades
news.summary: Is it really goodbye to TikTok‚Äîthis is what happens to your app tomorrow.
news.author: Contributor,Zak Doffman

news.title: Trump wants to visit China as president, US report says
news.text:
US president-elect Donald Trump has told advisers he wants to travel to China after he takes office, The Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday, quoting people familiar with the discussions.
Trump has expressed interest in travelling to China in his first 100 days in office, the report said, citing one of the people.
Trump‚Äôs inauguration is Monday, and Chinese state news agencies said on Friday that Chinese Vice-President Han Zheng will attend as Beijing stands ready to strengthen cooperation.
Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, through their representatives, have discussed meeting in person, with one option involving the incoming American president inviting the Chinese leader to the US, the WSJ added.
The Chinese embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
news.summary: The incoming US leader is interested in making the trip during his first 100 days, and has discussed it China‚Äôs Xi via their representatives.
news.author: Reuters

news.title: Trump reveals the three themes of his inauguration speech and hints at two early trips
news.text:
Donald Trump has reportedly said the three main themes of his inaugural speech on Monday will be ‚Äúunity, strength and fairness.‚Äù

The president-elect, who will be sworn in for his second term at the Capitol in Washington, D.C., has also said that he will sign around 100 executive actions on his first day, with the focus on immigration.

He has previously promised action on at least 59 topics on his first day in office, including ‚Äúthe largest deportation‚Äù in US history, ending the war in Ukraine and pardoning the January 6 rioters. The new administration‚Äôs deportation efforts are expected to begin in Chicago, with some 200 ICE agents targeting scores of migrants, including those with low-level criminal histories that would‚Äôve been deemed low priority by the Biden administration. 

Once he has taken office again, Trump is reportedly teasing an early visit to California, where wildfires in Los Angeles have killed more than 20 people, caused thousands to evacuate and caused millions in damage.

Reports suggest he could also be planning a trip to China ahead of what many expect to be a gruelling trade war between the world‚Äôs two biggest economies. Trump has repeatedly threatened tariffs of up to 60 percent against Beijing, which economists predict will hurt both countries‚Äô economies and, consequently, the wider world economy.

On Saturday afternoon, ABC News senior political correspondent Rachel Scott tweeted: ‚ÄúPresident-elect Donald Trump me tells me the three themes of his inauguration speech will be ‚Äúunity, strength and fairness.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe revealed the focus of his executive actions on Day One‚Äî telling me to expect a large focus on immigration and a rollback of Biden‚Äôs electric mandates.‚Äù

She added: ‚ÄúTrump confirms he will ‚Äòlikely‚Äô do a 90-day extension for TikTok and he plans to travel to California on Friday or sometime early next week.‚Äù

The reported themes of his speech would provide a stark contrast with his inaugural address on January 20, 2017, when he was sworn in for his first term.

That speech, which came to be known as ‚ÄúAmerican Carnage,‚Äù painted a dystopian vision of the US as a land of economic decline, rampant crime and political corruption.

In it, Trump said: ‚ÄúPoliticians prospered ‚Äî but the jobs left, and the factories closed. The establishment protected itself, but not the citizens of our country. Their victories have not been your victories; their triumphs have not been your triumphs; and while they celebrated in our nation‚Äôs capital, there was little to celebrate for struggling families all across our land. ... The forgotten men and women of our country will be forgotten no longer.‚Äù

Elsewhere in the speech he said: ‚ÄúMothers and children trapped in poverty in our inner cities; rusted-out factories scattered like tombstones across the landscape of our nation; an education system, flush with cash, but which leaves our young and beautiful students deprived of knowledge; and the crime and gangs and drugs that have stolen too many lives and robbed our country of so much unrealized potential. This American carnage stops right here and stops right now.‚Äù

The Wall Street Journal reports that Trump has told advisers he wants to make a trip to China, possibly during his first 100 days in office. It would be his second trip there following his first in 2017.

Trump‚Äôs relations with Chinese President Xi Jinping have been mixed, going from an apparently burgeoning friendship in the first years of his first term, to attacking him over Beijing‚Äôs handling of the Covid pandemic, which started in the Chinese city of Wuhan and which Trump repeatedly referred to as the ‚ÄúChina virus‚Äù or ‚ÄúKung Flu.‚Äù

The two leaders spoke by telephone on Friday. Xi had previously been invited to Monday‚Äôs inauguration but is sending his vice-president instead.
news.summary: President-elect will reportedly focus on ‚Äòunity, strength and fairness,‚Äô a contrast from his ‚ÄòAmerican carnage‚Äô message to the nation in 2017
news.author: Phil Thomas

news.title: Snoop Dogg and Nelly Face Fan Backlash Over Trump Inauguration Shows
news.text: Rappers Snoop Dogg and Nelly are performing at President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration events, with Snoop popping up at the first-ever "Crypto Ball" on Friday night and Nelly scheduled for the official Inaugural Liberty Ball on Monday.The performances mark a significant shift, particularly for Snoop Dogg, who previously criticized Trump and his MAGA supporters.Newsweek reached out to press contacts for both Snoop Dogg and Nelly via email on Saturday for comment.What To KnowThe Crypto Ball, hosted by incoming White House AI and "Crypto Czar" David Sacks, took place at the Andrew W. Mellon Auditorium in Washington D.C. on Friday night, with tickets ranging from $2,500 to $5,000.Snoop Dogg, dressed in a black jacket with gold buttons and a bowtie, performed hits including "Drop It Like It's Hot" while DJing a mix of crowd-pleasers from Journey's "Don't Stop Believin'" to Bob Marley's "Three Little Birds."The event drew other notable guests including fellow rapper Rick Ross and UFC star Colby Covington.Meanwhile, Grammy Award-winning artist Nelly, known for his global hit "Hot In Herre," will perform at the Inaugural Liberty Ball, one of three official inaugural celebrations on Monday according to a press release from the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee.The ContextSnoop Dogg's relationship with the president-elect has evolved significantly over the years.In 2017, he released a controversial music video featuring a Trump-inspired clown character and criticized Black artists who would perform for Trump. However, his stance shifted after Trump commuted the prison sentence of Death Row Records founder Michael "Harry-O" Harris.Harris had been serving time for attempted murder and cocaine trafficking at Lompoc Federal Correctional Institution when he received clemency on Trump's last day in office. This came after Snoop worked with activist Alice Johnson and producer Weldon Angelos to advocate for Harris's release. The Daily Beast reported that despite their previous conflicts, Snoop was "appreciative" of Trump's decision.In a January 2024 interview with The Sunday Times, Snoop said that Trump, "Ain't done nothing wrong to me. He has done only great things for me. He pardoned Michael Harris. So, I have nothing but love and respect for Donald Trump."What People Are Saying"This is culturally embarrassing and disrespectful asf [as f***]," wrote one Instagram user, while another referenced late rap icons: "Nipsey and Pac would never!!!"Podcast host Ryan Snead expressed strong criticism on X: "Yo @SnoopDogg What made you go from this to simping for a felon, business fraud, rapist, and accused pedophile who failed to deliver the first time around?"Combat veteran and fan Travis Matthew echoed the disappointment on X: "I never thought I'd have Snoop Dogg being a Trump supporter on my bingo card.... What a f****** disappointment."X user Lauren offered a broader perspective: "So Snoop Dogg and Nelly are both performing at Trump's inaugural celebrations. I'm disappointed in both of them. But at the end of the day, we have to remember that rich people do not give a damn about the rest of us."Some Trump supporters have welcomed the development, with one X user writing: "People are seeing the light finally," while another welcomed Snoop "to the winning team."What Happens NextPresident-elect Donald Trump is set to officially take the presidency for a second time on Inauguration Day, Monday, January 20.Additional performers include country star Carrie Underwood singing "America the Beautiful," opera singer Christopher Macchio performing the national anthem, and The Village People, whose generational hit "Y.M.C.A." is a Trump rally staple.
news.summary: Snoop Dogg and Nelly join Trump inauguration events amid fan backlash, marking a shift from Snoop's previous anti-Trump stance.
news.author: Adeola Adeosun

news.title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams‚Äô legal team trying to get public corruption case tossed by claiming ex-top fed prosecutor tainted jury pool
news.text:
Mayor Eric Adams‚Äô legal team is trying to get his public corruption case tossed by claiming a former top federal prosecutor is violating courtroom ethics laws by publicly smearing Hizzoner for political gain.

Ex-U.S. Attorney Damian Williams ‚Äî who resigned last month ahead of President-elect Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration ‚Äî ‚Äúeffectively announced his intent to challenge Mayor Adams in the political arena‚Äù by authoring an op-ed that appeared Thursday in City & State, portraying Gotham in ‚Äúdeep crisis and ‚Äúbeing led with a broken ethical compass,‚Äù wrote Adams lawyer Alex Spiro in a letter Manhattan federal Judge Dale E. Ho.

Spiro also noted Williams created a website last month to promote himself, which include links to media articles that ‚Äúdisparage Adams.‚Äù

The letter ‚Äì which was first seen by The Post Saturday before being delivered to the judge ‚Äì alleges Williams is violating federal courtroom ethics laws by ‚Äúengaging in extrajudicial commentary that would interfere with a fair trial.‚Äù

It also alleges Williams is violating New York Rules of Professional Conduct, which ‚Äúsimilarly restrict‚Äù publicity in ongoing criminal trials by lawyers who‚Äôve participated in a case, even if they no longer are involved.

‚ÄúMr. Williams brought a meritless case against a political rival to bolster his own immediate candidacy for office, potentially including Mayor of New York City,‚Äù Spiro contented in his four-page letter.

‚ÄúNot only is this conduct highly unethical, but it confirms this U.S. Attorney‚Äôs office‚Äôs strategy of prejudicing the jury pool and should be considered by the court when ruling‚Äù on a motion by Adams‚Äô attorneys to dismiss the case.

‚ÄúMr. Williams‚Äô ethical obligations did not disappear when he resigned as U.S. Attorney,‚Äù added Spiro.

The letter demands not only that the case be dismissed but that the U.S. Department of Justice open a probe into whether Adams‚Äô prosecution ‚Äúwas brought for improper purposes‚Äù by Williams.

Williams has never publicly said he is eyeing a political run.

Both he and the U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office did not immediately return messages Saturday.

Adams in September became the first sitting mayor in NYC‚Äôs history to be charged with federal crimes, indicted for allegedly taking bribes and illegal campaign contributions from foreign sources.

He pled not guilty, vowed to remain in office, and is scheduled to stand trial in April.
news.summary: Mayor Eric Adams‚Äô legal team is trying to get his public corruption case tossed by claiming a former top federal prosecutor is violating courtroom ethics laws by publicly smearing Hizzoner for political gain.
news.author: Rich Calder

news.title: Charlamagne Tha God rethinks whether Trump is a ‚Äòfascist‚Äô after ‚Äòleaderless‚Äô Dems‚Äô actions since election loss
news.text:
Charlamagne Tha God admitted he‚Äôs considering walking back his old claims that President-elect Donald Trump is a ‚Äúfascist‚Äù following recent actions by Democrats. 

The comedian, 46, expressed disappointment with the Democratic Party and their reactions to losing the November election ‚Äî even questioning whether the incoming commander in chief ever really posed a ‚Äúthreat.‚Äù

‚ÄúI never called Donald Trump a fascist based off anything I heard from Democrats. I said that because of things I heard come out of Donald Trump,‚Äù Charlamagne said on Friday‚Äôs episode of ‚ÄúBrilliant Idiots.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut guess what? I don‚Äôt even know if I believe it anymore, but only because of how they‚Äôre acting. I‚Äôm like, well goddamn, maybe it ain‚Äôt that much of a threat.‚Äù

The admission whipped co-host Andrew Schulz into a frenzy: ‚ÄúExactly! They lied to you.‚Äù

Charlamagne went on to accuse the Democratic Party of being ‚Äúleaderless.‚Äù

‚ÄúRepublicans have to show me. I need to see them ruin the country like Democrats say they are going to ruin the country, for me to ever believe anything Democrats have to say ever again,‚Äù he continued.

Despite his blatant frustration, Charlamagne emphasized that he would not have changed his vote for the 2024 presidential election and has continued to support Vice President Kamala Harris, who he called a ‚Äúfriend.‚Äù

The pair had previously agreed to call Trump ‚Äúfascist‚Äù during an hour-long radio town hall hosted on iHeartRadio in October.

Harris was describing the choice voters had between her campaign and Trump‚Äôs when Charlamagne, whose real name is Lenard McKelvey, brought up fascism.

‚ÄúThe other is about fascism. Why can‚Äôt we just say it?‚Äù Charlamagne asked in reference to Trump.

‚ÄúYes, we can say that,‚Äù Harris replied.
news.summary:
Charlamagne Tha God admitted he‚Äôs considering walking back his old claims that President-elect Donald Trump is a ‚Äúfascist‚Äù following recent actions by Democrats. The comedian, 46, expressed disappointment with the Democratic Party and their reactions to losing the November election ‚Äî even questioning whether the incoming commander in chief ever really posed a ‚Äúthreat.‚Äù ‚ÄúI …
